title: 0.1 GDY Schema
description: The schema for the Griddly Description YAML language (version 0.1)

Version.title: Version
Version.description: The version of the GDY yaml schema

Environment.title: Environment
Environment.description: Contains the definition of how the player interacts with the environment and how it is percieved by the players

oneOf.title: Player Id
oneOf.description: Includes the player id in the vector representation of each tile.

oneOf.title: Player Id
oneOf.description: Includes the player Id in the entity features.

oneOf.title: Rotation
oneOf.description: Includes the rotation of the object in the vector representation of each tile.

oneOf.title: Rotation
oneOf.description: Includes the entity orientation in the features.

GlobalVariableMapping.title: Global Variable Mapping
GlobalVariableMapping.description: A list of variables to include.

VariableMapping.title: VariableMapping
VariableMapping.description: A map of entities to their variables which will be visible in the entity observations

^\\w+$.title: Mapping
^\\w+$.description: Which variables for which objects are added as features

IncludeVariables.title: Include Variables
IncludeVariables.description: Includes the value of variables in vector representation of each tile.

IncludeMasks.title: Include Masks
IncludeMasks.description: Includes the Actor Ids and requisite action masks in entity observations.

ResourceConfig.title: ResourceConfig
ResourceConfig.description: Configuration options for the observer resources, such as images and shader paths.

ImagePath.title: Image Path
ImagePath.description: The path to the images used in this observer.

ShaderPath.title: Shader Path
ShaderPath.description: The path to the compiled shaders used in this observer.

GlobalVariables.title: Expose Global Variables
GlobalVariables.description: A list of global variables that will be available in the shaders.

ObjectVariables.title: Expose Object Variables
ObjectVariables.description: A list of object variables that will be available in the shaders

ObserverAvatarMode.title: ObserverAvatarMode
ObserverAvatarMode.description: The type of trigger to use.

ObserverAvatarHighlightColor.title: Color
ObserverAvatarHighlightColor.description: The color of the highlighting to use

TileSize.title: Tile Size
TileSize.description: Tile size to use for sprites.

oneOf.title: Square Tile
oneOf.description: A single value for both the height and width of the tiles

oneOf.title: Rectangular Tile
oneOf.description: Width and height of the tiles

BackgroundColor.title: Color
BackgroundColor.description: The color of the background of the game

BackgroundTile.title: Background Tile
BackgroundTile.description: The image that should be used as a background tile

IsoTileHeight.title: IsoTileHeight
IsoTileHeight.description: The height of a floor tile in pixels of the isometric tile. This is measure from the bottom of the tile

IsoTileDepth.title: IsoTileDepth
IsoTileDepth.description: The number of pixels used to cover the depth effect of isometric tiles

HighlightPlayers.title: Highlight Players
HighlightPlayers.description: Add highlights to the players in visual observers.

RotateWithAvatar.title: Rotate with avatar
RotateWithAvatar.description: The observer view will rotate to follow the orientation of the avatar.

RotateAvatarImage.title: Rotate Avatar Image
RotateAvatarImage.description: The observer will rotate the avatar image if the orientation changes.

TrackAvatar.title: Track Avatar
TrackAvatar.description: The observer view will track the position of the avatar.

OffsetX.title: OffsetX
OffsetX.description: X offset of the observer window.

OffsetY.title: OffsetY
OffsetY.description: Y offset of the observation window.

Player.title: Player
Player.description: Defines how players (algorithms, agents, humans) interact with the environment.

Count.title: Player Count
Count.description: The number of players in the environment

AvatarObject.title: Avatar Object
AvatarObject.description: The player will control a single object in the environment.

Observer.title: Observer Configuration
Observer.description: Defines how the observations will be generated for the players in the game.

HighlightPlayers.title: Highlight Players
HighlightPlayers.description: Add highlights to the players in visual observers.

RotateWithAvatar.title: Rotate with avatar
RotateWithAvatar.description: The observer view will rotate to follow the orientation of the avatar.

RotateAvatarImage.title: Rotate Avatar Image
RotateAvatarImage.description: The observer will rotate the avatar image if the orientation changes.

TrackAvatar.title: Track Avatar
TrackAvatar.description: The observer view will track the position of the avatar.

OffsetX.title: OffsetX
OffsetX.description: X offset of the observer window.

OffsetY.title: OffsetY
OffsetY.description: Y offset of the observation window.

Variables.title: Global Variables
Variables.description: Definition global variables that can be access from any action.

items.title: Variable
items.description: Define a global variable such as number of items collected, actions performed etc.

InitialValue.title: Variable Initial Value
InitialValue.description: The initial value of the variable

PerPlayer.title: Per Player Variable
PerPlayer.description: The variable is not shared between players, each player has their own version of this variable

Termination.title: Termination
Termination.description: Definition of the termination conditions of the environment.

Lose.title: Lose Conditions
Lose.description: If any of these conditions are met, the player associated with this condition will lose the game.

Win.title: Win Conditions
Win.description: If any of these conditions are met, the player associated with this condition will win the game.

End.title: End Conditions
End.description: If any of these conditions are met, the game will end.

terminationConditionV2.title: Termination Conditions V2
terminationConditionV2.description: When a termination condition is met, the game will reset itself. If there are multiple players, the termination arguments are expanded internally "per player". This can be used to find the first player to a certain number of objects, or the first player to reach a certain score

Conditions.title: Conditions
Conditions.description: If any of these conditions are met, the game will end and distribute rewards to the associated players.

Reward.title: Reward
Reward.description: The reward given to the agent if this conditions is met.

OpposingReward.title: Opposing Reward
OpposingReward.description: The reward given to other agents if this condition is met.

terminationConditionV1.title: Termination Conditions V1
terminationConditionV1.description: When a termination condition is met, the game will reset itself. If there are multiple players, the termination arguments are expanded internally "per player". This can be used to find the first player to a certain number of objects, or the first player to reach a certain score

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: Check if the arguments are equal

neq.title: Not Equals
neq.description: Check if the arguments are not equal

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: Check if the first argument is greater than the second

gte.title: Greater Than Or Equal
gte.description: Check if the first argument is greater than or equal to the second

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: Check if the first argument is less than the second

lte.title: Less Than Or Equal
lte.description: Check if the first argument is less than or equal to the second

terminationArgument.description: An argument to the termination condition. If there are multiple players, then these arguments expand internally as "per player"
terminationArgument.title: Termination Arguments

anyOf.title: Object Count
anyOf.description: Returns the number of objects of the object name before the colon, for example ``flower:count`` or ``car:count``

anyOf.title: Max Steps
anyOf.description: Returns the number of game ticks that have passed

Levels.title: Game Level Maps
Levels.description: Level Strings which define the levels in the game environment.

Actions.title: Actions
Actions.description: Actions define all the game mechanics.

Probability.title: Probability
Probability.description: The probability that this action is executed.

Trigger.title: Trigger
Trigger.description: Triggers can be used to set proximity and other triggers for actions.

Type.title: Type
Type.description: The type of trigger to use.

Range.title: Range
Range.description: The proximity of the objects required for this action to be executed.

Relative.title: Relative
Relative.description: If the Offset of the collision detector should be relative to the direction that the object is facing.

items.title: Offset Coordinate
items.description: Coordinate for rendering offset of isometric tiles

InputMapping.title: Input Mappping
InputMapping.description: Map action Ids to in-environment actions

Inputs.title: Inputs
Inputs.description: Each Key maps a single Action Id to a vector to the action's destination and an orientation vector.

MetaData.title: MetaData
MetaData.description: A map of values that can be attributed with this action, that can be used in action behaviour logic

Description.title: Description
Description.description: A friendly description of the action and what it maps to in the environment. e.g Move up, Rotate left, Fire arrow....

OrientationVector.title: OrientationVector
OrientationVector.description: A unit vector used to set the orientation of an object in the environment. Sets the _dir internal variable

VectorToDest.title: VectorToDest
VectorToDest.description: A vector which gives the gives the direction in which the action is taken.

Relative.title: Relative
Relative.description: If the vectors in the actions should be calculated relative to the orientation of the object that is being acted upon.

Internal.title: Relative
Internal.description: If the action is set as internal, it cannot be used by any players.

MapToGrid.title: MapToGrid
MapToGrid.description: Maps the action to the entire grid rather than locations relative to an object.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: The name given to an action such as "move" or "push".

Behaviours.title: Behaviours
Behaviours.description: The list of behaviours that define what happens to objects when actions are performed.

items.title: Behaviour Definition
items.description: Behaviour definitions are how Griddly builds the mechanics of environments. Behaviour definitions are made up of two components, the "source" behaviour and "destination" behaviour.

Src.title: Source
Src.description: Define the behaviour of the source object of an action.

Preconditions.title: Behaviour Preconditions
Preconditions.description: A list of checks that have to be performed before this action is executed.

Dst.title: Dest
Dst.description: Define the behaviour of the destination object of an action.

Probability.title: Probability
Probability.description: The probability that this particular behaviour is executed.

behaviourDefinitionObject.title: Behaviour Objects
behaviourDefinitionObject.description: The object or list of objects that this behaviour applies to.

oneOf.title: Single Object
oneOf.description: A single object the behaviour is applied to.

oneOf.title: List of Objects
oneOf.description: A list of object the behaviour is applied to

behaviourDefinitionPreconditionCommand.title: Behaviour Precondition
behaviourDefinitionPreconditionCommand.description: A check that must be performed before any action. This can be used to change the behaviour of objects based on their internal variables. For example checking whether an object has a key before opening a door.

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: Check if the arguments are equal

neq.title: Not Equals
neq.description: Check if the arguments are not equal

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: Check if the first argument is greater than the second

gte.title: Greater Than Or Equal
gte.description: Check if the first argument is greater than or equal to the second

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: Check if the first argument is less than the second

lte.title: Less Than Or Equal
lte.description: Check if the first argument is less than or equal to the second

behaviourDefinitionConditionalCommand.title: Conditional Behaviour Command
behaviourDefinitionConditionalCommand.description: A conditional command to run as part of an action behaviour.

eq.title: Equals
eq.description: The specified commands will only be run if the arguments are equal.

lt.title: Less Than
lt.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is less than the second.

lte.title: Less Than Or Equal
lte.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is less than or equal to the second.

gt.title: Greater Than
gt.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is greater than the second.

gte.title: Greater Than Or Equal
gte.description: The specified commands will only be run if the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to the second.

behaviourDefinitionCommand.title: Behaviour Command
behaviourDefinitionCommand.description: A command to run as part of an action behaviour.

mov.description: Move the object to the location provided.
mov.title: Move

rot.title: Rotate
rot.description: Rotate the object to the direction supplied

add.title: Add
add.description: Add a value from a variable. For example "- add: [my_variable 10]" will add 10 to "my_variable".

sub.title: Sub
sub.description: Subtract a value from a variable. For example "- sub: [my_variable 10]" will subtract 10 from "my_variable".

set.title: Set
set.description: Sets the value of a variable. For example "- set: [my_variable 10]" will set the value of "my_variable" to 10.

cascade.title: Cascade Action
cascade.description: Repeat this action again in the same direction.

reward.title: Reward
reward.description: Increase the reward by the value specified. If the object is associated with a player, that player's reward is increased.

remove.title: Remove
remove.description: Remove the object from the environment.

change_to.title: Change Object
change_to.description: Swaps this object for another one. (this does not preserve any properties of the current object)

set_tile.title: Set Tile
set_tile.description: When multiple tiles are defined for an object in the Observer configurations, this can be used to set the current tile the object is using to render.

spawn.title: Spawn
spawn.description: Spawns an object. For example "- spawn: ghost" will spawn a ghost object.

Action.title: Action
Action.description: The name of the action to perform.

Randomize.title: Randomize
Randomize.description: If set to true, a random action is chosen from the input mapping.

Delay.title: Delay
Delay.description: The action will be executed after this number of game ticks.

ActionId.title: ActionId
ActionId.description: The ID of the action in action mappings to perform.

Search.title: AStar Search
Search.description: Executes the action with the action Id that is on the optimal search path to the destination object.

ImpassableObjects.title: Impassable Objects
ImpassableObjects.description: Objects that should be considered impassable by the search algorithm.

items.title: Object Name
items.description: Names of the objects that are impassable.

TargetObjectName.title: Target Object Name
TargetObjectName.description: The search algorithm navigate to the closest of these objects.

Mode.title: Mode
Mode.description: Whether the object will seek or flee from the target object.

TargetLocation.title: Target Location
TargetLocation.description: Instead of navigating to a particular object, we can navigate to a particular location

items.title: Target Coordinate
items.description: Coordinate for rendering offset of isometric tiles

destArgument.title: Destination
destArgument.description: The destination location of the action.

srcArgument.title: Source
srcArgument.description: The source location of the action.

commandArgumentList.title: Command Arguments
commandArgumentList.description: Arguments supplied to the commmand, can be integer values or variable names.

commandArgument.description: An argument to a behaviour command.
commandArgument.title: Command Argument

oneOf.title: Variable Name
oneOf.description: Any variables defined on the object can be used

Objects.title: Objects
Objects.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

items.title: Object Definition
items.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

Z.title: Z Index
Z.description: The Z index of an object

InitialActions.title: Initial Actions
InitialActions.description: Actions that are performed as soon as the object is initialized. Can be for constant and random movements.

items.title: Initial Action
items.description: A list of actions that are performed by this object when it is initialized into the environment.

Action.title: Action
Action.description: The name of the action to perform.

Randomize.title: Randomize
Randomize.description: If set to true, a random action is chosen from the input mapping.

Delay.title: Delay
Delay.description: The action will be executed after this number of game ticks.

ActionId.title: ActionId
ActionId.description: The ID of the action in action mappings to perform.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

MapCharacter.title: Map Character
MapCharacter.description: The character this object is represented by in the level mapping.

Variables.title: Variable Definitions
Variables.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

items.title: Variable
items.description: Define an object variable, such as health, items collected etc...

InitialValue.title: Variable Initial Value
InitialValue.description: The initial value of the variable

Observers.title: Observers configuration
Observers.description: Configure how the observers render the object

^\\w+$.title: Object Observer Config
^\\w+$.description: Configure how the object renders in the observer

Offset.description: Rendering offset for this specific tile.
Offset.title: Offset

items.title: Offset Coordinate
items.description: Coordinate for rendering offset of isometric tiles

Shape.title: Shape
Shape.description: The shape to use for this particular object

Scale.title: Scale
Scale.description: The scale of the shape. if 1.0 the shape will fill the grid location.

Image.description: Either a list of image tiles or a single image
Image.title: Sprite Image

oneOf.title: Single Image
oneOf.description: A single image to use for ever occurence of this object.

oneOf.title: Image Tiles
oneOf.description: A list of image tiles to combine for animations or walls.

items.title: Image Tile
items.description: A list of 2 or 16 tiles that make up the sprites for walls. Use in combination with TileMode.
